name: lvecring

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c0, clmod))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ LVec, c1 ∈ Ring, c0 ∈ LMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec → c1 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LVec → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Ring)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec → c1 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LVec → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Ring)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec → c1 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Ring)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))

comment: The scalar component of a left vector is a ring. (Contributed by Steven Nguyen, 28-May-2023.)
